result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Exposing Genitals, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.10(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: * October 6, 2022/Judge David Borowski: Court ordered the JOC amended by commuting the term of initial confinement on Count 1 to one year and six months.*
Probation review hearing  in BR. 12 on November 11, 2022 at 8:30 a.m.

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank.
The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA and victim witness surcharge and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Restitution set at zero.
Seek and maintain full time employment.

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
No contact with the victim  or any child 16 or younger.

Mental health examination and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
Complete sex offender evaluation and comply with any treatment
Court imposes and stays sex offender registration.
AODA assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.  Absolute sobriety.

timeConds.notes: Straight time.  Imposed and stayed pending review.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin Williams

records.addlTxt: Probation Review Report received and filed.  bm
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  bm

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as amended and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Court advised Defendant as a convicted felon he may not vote until his civil rights are restored and he may never possess a firearm/weapon.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Negotiations placed on the record and confirmed by the parties. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 182 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 18 MONTHS

The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Serve 60  DAYS in the House of Correction STRAIGHT TIME imposed and stayed pending review.
-Mental Health Examintion and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with the victim or any child 16 or younger
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.
-ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
-AODA Assessment and comply with any treatment deemed appropriate.
-Complete Sex Offender Evaluation and comply with any treatment
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-Restitution set at zero.

-The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges (including the DNA and victim/witness surcharge) and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections and as a condition of probation/ extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

-Court imposes and stays sex offender registration.

Case adjourned for Probatin Review Hearing in Br. 12.  

The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.

FILED: Memorandum of Conditions of Probation; Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence

Defendant Justin Williams in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Justin Williams in custody.  Samuel Tufford for Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Exposing Genitals, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 948.10(1) and (1)(a); 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Defense waived reading.

Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court, defendant Justin Williams not in court, in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: nk
Defendant's Appearance Waived due being in quarantine for testing positive for COVID-19.  Case in Court for Plea/Sentencing Hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Motion to Seal Court Records.  Received and Filed.  nk
Psychosexual Evaluation and Risk Assessment.  Received and Filed.  nk
Sentencing Memorandum.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Justin Williams in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Justin Williams in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has discovery and requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court authorizes transfer of Defendant's other pending matter for global resolution.  22CF000174.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.
State compliant with victmi9 notification.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Justin Williams in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Justin Williams in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Scheduling Conference held.  Defense has received discovery and requests time to review.  Court grants request.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Motion to Modify Bail received and filed.  bm

Defendant Justin Williams in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Justin Williams in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  This hearing will be streamed live on YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCqYxLDHV-xN_RkKf_fE1jjw  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list. LIMITED CURFEW. Defendant to be in home from 6pm to 7am daily. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DDN (DOB: 2/1/2006)
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Defendant Justin Williams in court with attorney Travis Schwantes.  Defendant Justin Williams in custody.  Mario Fiumefreddo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Justin Williams appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   DEFENDANT QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
